    • Models

    Extract coefficients of a DiscSurv object

    coef.DiscSurv.Rd

    Return the model coefficients of a DiscSurv object

    # S3 method for DiscSurv
coef(fit, lambda, which = 1:length(fit$lambda), drop = TRUE, ...)

    Arguments

    fit

    a DiscSurv object.

    lambda

    values of the regularization parameter lambda at which coefficients are requested. For values of lambda not in the sequence of fitted models, linear interpolation is used.

    which

    indices of the penalty parameter lambda at which predictions are required. By default, all indices are returned. If lambda is specified, this will override which.

    drop

    whether to keep coefficient names

    ...

    Examples

    data(Surv_Data)
data <- Surv_Data$data
Event.char <- Surv_Data$Event.char
Z.char <- Surv_Data$Z.char
Time.char <- Surv_Data$Time.char
fit <- DiscSurv(data, Event.char, Z.char, Time.char)
coef(fit, lambda = fit$lambda)$alpha[, 1:10]
#>                 0.4261    0.3882    0.3537    0.3223    0.2937    0.2676
#> [Time: 0.53] -1.979501 -1.970055 -1.977003 -1.996580 -2.025995 -2.063282
#> [Time: 1.03] -2.110213 -2.069229 -2.043936 -2.030857 -2.027109 -2.024876
#> [Time: 3.92] -2.484907 -2.418504 -2.367851 -2.329504 -2.300530 -2.271874
#> [Time: 6.74] -2.355695 -2.272311 -2.204520 -2.148985 -2.102809 -2.057108
#> [Time: 12.5] -2.958691 -2.863140 -2.784495 -2.719193 -2.664056 -2.607945
#>                 0.2438    0.2221    0.2024    0.1844
#> [Time: 0.53] -2.108324 -2.159493 -2.215493 -2.275318
#> [Time: 1.03] -2.029989 -2.041122 -2.057140 -2.077191
#> [Time: 3.92] -2.250813 -2.236115 -2.226725 -2.221916
#> [Time: 6.74] -2.019042 -1.987404 -1.961175 -1.939720
#> [Time: 12.5] -2.560084 -2.519222 -2.484281 -2.454645
coef(fit, lambda = fit$lambda)$beta[, 1:10]
#>    0.4261     0.3882     0.3537     0.3223       0.2937      0.2676     0.2438
#> Z1      0 -0.1556065 -0.2988513 -0.4321738 -0.555178202 -0.62730613 -0.6970826
#> Z2      0  0.0000000  0.0000000  0.0000000  0.000000000  0.00000000  0.0000000
